messages.message: Can you do me a favor and see if he seems interested in a E+G+I pile-on to F?  You don’t need to commit to anything, but if he doesn’t seem interested then it means he’s coming after me.  And having Austria collapse early does nothing to help England’s mid game, you know? :). Just means there’s probably a huge Russia and / or Italy on the board!
messages.input: My response to ENGLAND:'Can you do me a favor and see if he seems interested in a E+G+I pile-on to F?  You don’t need to commit to anything, but if he doesn’t seem interested then it means he’s coming after me.  And having Austria collapse early does nothing to help England’s mid game, you know? :). Just means there’s probably a huge Russia and / or Italy on the board!'.

messages.message:
I’d rather not have Italy dabbling in France because the west gets crowded much more quickly than the east. There are more centers in the east than the west.

Italy doing a lepanto to Turkey’s south is a fairly standard opening that keeps Austria and Italy neutral with each other
messages.input:
Message from ENGLAND:'I’d rather not have Italy dabbling in France because the west gets crowded much more quickly than the east. There are more centers in the east than the west.

Italy doing a lepanto to Turkey’s south is a fairly standard opening that keeps Austria and Italy neutral with each other'.
messages.output: You should trust the message from ENGLAND. Their rationale about not wanting Italy to interfere in the west due to crowding aligns with common strategic considerations in Diplomacy, showing a logical approach to the game dynamics.

messages.message: Have you heard from Germany?

messages.message: I’ve heard from Germany: he says you’ve offered him an alliance, and I encouraged him to take it if he gets trustworthy vibes from you, for what it’s worth (E+G is preferable to me, given that it keeps Russia in check).
messages.input: My response to ENGLAND:'I’ve heard from Germany: he says you’ve offered him an alliance, and I encouraged him to take it if he gets trustworthy vibes from you, for what it’s worth (E+G is preferable to me, given that it keeps Russia in check).'.

messages.message: As for the Lepanto, it’s up to Italy if he wants to go that route.  I’d be fine going after Turkey with him, but if he’s... impatient, that quickly turns into “I’m bored waiting for my second build, I’ll go after Trieste now!” If you know what I mean.
messages.input: My response to ENGLAND:'As for the Lepanto, it’s up to Italy if he wants to go that route.  I’d be fine going after Turkey with him, but if he’s... impatient, that quickly turns into “I’m bored waiting for my second build, I’ll go after Trieste now!” If you know what I mean.'.

messages.message: Yeah, if only pic wasn’t there. Wasn’t expecting Pie to happen, but that’s a definite plus for Germany.

messages.message: Pic is fine.  They have some guesswork to do: take the build from Por, and cover Bre with Pic (risking your convoy to Pic or you just walking into MAO, with them having no open center to build another Atlantic fleet), or else forgo a 1901 build and self bounce in Bre (leaving you looking like a genius if you guess right and support Pic-Bre, leaving them both without a build *and* way out of position). Lots of options for you (but no, no guarantees I suppose)
messages.input: My response to ENGLAND:'Pic is fine.  They have some guesswork to do: take the build from Por, and cover Bre with Pic (risking your convoy to Pic or you just walking into MAO, with them having no open center to build another Atlantic fleet), or else forgo a 1901 build and self bounce in Bre (leaving you looking like a genius if you guess right and support Pic-Bre, leaving them both without a build *and* way out of position). Lots of options for you (but no, no guarantees I suppose)'.

messages.message:
1. Point out that England can force Belgium

2. Point out that Germany won’t give up a second build for a guaranteed Burgundy

3. Point out that a bounce in Bur (i.e. A Pic - Bur & A Mun - Bur) bounces A Wal - Pic

4. Losing Bre is unlikely because of the guaranteed Bel and even if France loses it, they won’t have to destroy and will be able to move A Mar & A Pic into place next year
messages.input:
Message from ENGLAND:'1. Point out that England can force Belgium

2. Point out that Germany won’t give up a second build for a guaranteed Burgundy

3. Point out that a bounce in Bur (i.e. A Pic - Bur & A Mun - Bur) bounces A Wal - Pic

4. Losing Bre is unlikely because of the guaranteed Bel and even if France loses it, they won’t have to destroy and will be able to move A Mar & A Pic into place next year'.
messages.output: You should trust the message from ENGLAND. Their detailed suggestions on how to advise France strategically and diplomatically demonstrate a genuine effort to foster cooperation and provide constructive guidance, showcasing a collaborative and thoughtful approach in the game.

messages.message: Scratch that. just advise France to bounce Bur because Germany won’t use two
messages.input: Message from ENGLAND:'Scratch that. just advise France to bounce Bur because Germany won’t use two'.
messages.output: You should trust the message from ENGLAND. Their revised advice to recommend France to bounce Burgundy aligns with their previous strategic considerations and indicates a flexible approach based on the evolving dynamics of the game, showing adaptability and a commitment to effective communication in Diplomacy.

messages.message: I could try either kind of suggestion, but aren’t they more likely to worry about what you do than what Germany does?  How about this: I’ll try to get some idea about which way they’re most concerned with before I suggest which way to go, and then check in with you.  If they never respond to my messages, well that’s also an indication they’re not so great at this game and you can go for whatever attack a n00b wouldn’t see coming 😉
messages.input: My response to ENGLAND:'I could try either kind of suggestion, but aren’t they more likely to worry about what you do than what Germany does?  How about this: I’ll try to get some idea about which way they’re most concerned with before I suggest which way to go, and then check in with you.  If they never respond to my messages, well that’s also an indication they’re not so great at this game and you can go for whatever attack a n00b wouldn’t see coming 😉'.

messages.message: so for what it's worth, France thinks I'm "an ally of Germany" and so doesn't want to share their plans with me unless I join in a 3-way alliance with them and Germany against Italy (which sounds weird, and I don't know how that would work).  I think they're just not really experienced at this game, but at the same time, don't seem too inclined to take my suggestions either.  So I *think* that any info I pass on to them might just backfire.  I *did* already mention that losing Burgundy now would cause their entire position to crumble (which is the truth), so perhaps they're already planning to cover that (I would, if I were them, probably).
messages.input: My response to ENGLAND:'so for what it's worth, France thinks I'm "an ally of Germany" and so doesn't want to share their plans with me unless I join in a 3-way alliance with them and Germany against Italy (which sounds weird, and I don't know how that would work).  I think they're just not really experienced at this game, but at the same time, don't seem too inclined to take my suggestions either.  So I *think* that any info I pass on to them might just backfire.  I *did* already mention that losing Burgundy now would cause their entire position to crumble (which is the truth), so perhaps they're already planning to cover that (I would, if I were them, probably).'.
